Each market_trades event's trade object looks like this:

{product_id: 'BTC-USD', trade_id: '813758561', price: '84610.09', size: '0.00102805', time: '2025-04-18T18:29:07.190435Z', â€¦}

And the following logging code...

console.log(trade.trade_id,trade.side, trade.price, trade.size, trade.time);

...produced this:

(index):665 813770524 BUY 84544.91 0.001 2025-04-18T19:40:42.779222Z
(index):665 813770523 BUY 84544.91 0.00011828 2025-04-18T19:40:42.779222Z

This shows that...

- Both snapshots and updates can have a mix of BUY and SELL.
- There is a trade per price per order (as one would expect).
- The trades are in stack (reverse) order, even the snapshot.
- One can reasonably infer a single taker when microseconds match.

This is the kind of research that needs to be done per exchange.
